I would also like an answer to Q1 I have similar issues with UK Postcodes

I know in response to Q2 the old API allows you to do this
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/create_deal>

With the new API on this page it seems to suggest you just have to use the associations endpoints
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>
“Associations between deals and other objects
Deals can be associated with contacts, companies, engagements, line items, and tickets. It’s important to note that they have one: many relationships with contacts and companies. Associations can be managed through the CRM associations endpoints.”

But I may be wrong, the new docs don’t seem to give quite enough information to work out all the extra little things you need to do

*3. Retrieve all activities per deal in one call*
You can get the deal info via API, and in the same request get its associations. When fetching information about a deal by ID you can include optional parameter about associations, here you can include an array like TASK,NOTE,EMAIL,MEETING etc.

You can find more about it on new docs here and you can even have a request generated by your parameters: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>

The rest of these are great questions. I'll be following the thread and if I figure some other stuff out I'll get back on this.

Hey all,

Is there any way to use HubSpot authentication for an app hosted on HubSpot website pages only by the frontend without the need to have a separate server to handle OAuth 2.0 flow?

I'm trying to build a React app that is hosted on one of the HubSpot pages, and I've managed to build the app and host it but I can't figure out how to do the user authentication. I'd prefer Auth over memberships because support told me there is no way to get the access token for the user when using memberships, and I need access token because I don't want to use API key on the frontend.

Hey channel. I'm wondering if anyone has experience using the Marketing API to send Marketing Events for when a user takes an action on a web app.

I have a 7 part email series that introduces users to our platform, but I only want to trigger the next email in the workflow after the user meets certain criteria. For example we would only send email 2 if the user has logged in, email 3 if they viewed a certain page, email 4 if they clicked a button.

We have Marketing Pro (not Ops Pro) so I am restricted with the Marketing API, hence would (I assume) need to configure the Register and / or Attend values for each event.

Anyone configured something similar with Marketing API before?

Thank you for your replies :slightly_smiling_face:

<@UDJV5B73R> about #2, I can see in the docs you can pass `associatedCompanyIds` but how can you pass the association to a contact? I tried `associatedContactIds` and it doesn’t work.

<@U02CZ064R0D> about #3 - I missed that. It saves a few calls. But still you then need to retrieve each activity one by one, and that’s the biggest issue. Do you know if there’s a way of getting them all at once?
Something like `deals/:id/activities` :thinking_face:
I think it’s just the `associatedVids` in the example json
<@U02CZ064R0D> yeah, I didn’t find alternatives either. Seems such a strange choice from HubSpot to have you fetch them one by one…
They have a batch for contacts and some other type of data, they will probably develop it at some point in the future. It sucks for now though :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah I’ve done some API stuff that literally loops through making API requests, obviously just have to be wary of usage limits

If it were me, I’d use the CRM API to update contact properties that can then be referenced in the workflow tool. For example, create a property called “Has Logged In,” write an action in your app that updates the contact’s value for this property to “True.” Then you could use a combination of the workflow and/or smart list tools to enroll that user in an automation to send email two
